solution.text:
\(a_n=a_1+(n-1)*d\)
\(_{{j+(l-1)*k}}_=a_1+_{{l-1}}_*d\)
\(_{{j+(l+4)*k}}_=a_1+_{{l+4}}_*d\)
solving the pair of linear equations with \(a_1\) and \(d\)as variables we get
\(a_1=_{j}_,d=_{k}_\)
Once we have the first term and the common difference we can fiqure out the complete AP
Therefore,
2nd term = \(a_1+d\) = _{j}_+_{k}_ = _{{j+k}}_

content.text: What is the 2nd term in the AP whose _{l}_th and _{{l+5}}_th terms are _{{j+(l-1)*k}}_ and _{{j+(l+4)*k}}_ respectively
